page.title: 07SHOPPING IN HALE.
page.content: A Survey team were responsible for counting the amenities in Hale; they counted an interesting variety of shops, especially high class grocers, clothing boutiques and furnishings. They were, however, surprised when they asked shoppers what they thought of this busy shopping street,{Ashley {Road.}People were pleased with the variety but visited Altrincham for lower prices. Despite the numerous banks people wanted a{Post Office.}The residents were pleased with the lack of "fast" food shops, even restaurants, which they thought may harm the area. Transport, however, was seen as a major problem, Hale is a busy area but has only one Zebra Crossing. Car parking facilities and bus services are inadequate. Shoppers need help without ruining the residential character of the area.
